Class Operand3a

  • java.lang.Object
    • Operand3a
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CGInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConstSymbol, FunctionSymbol, LabelSymbol, VarSymbol

    public abstract class Operand3a
extends java.lang.Object
implements CGInterface
    Abstract class for implementing TAC operands (which are also the "symbols" stored in the SymbolTable). This class has the minimal set of attributes for (assembler) code generation. The abstract methods defined in the interface are also necessary for assembler code generation. They might be useful for type checking and TAC generation.

    The offset attribute is set and used by the machine code generator. It represents the address of the operand relative to the top of the function frame in the execution stack. You don't need it in the frontend.

    Author:
    MLB

      • getName3a

        public abstract java.lang.String getName3a()
        Description copied from interface: CGInterface
        This method must return a printable view of a TAC operand. Variable name for a variable, integer string for an integer. Recall that the TAC name of a function is the associated label!!
        Specified by:
        getName3a in interface CGInterface
        Returns:
        String
